definitions.text: an angular or rounded shape made by folding
a group of people who adhere to a common faith and habitually attend a given church
a geological process that causes a bend in a stratum of rock
a group of sheep or goats
a folded part (as in skin or muscle)

examples: he gave the napkins a double fold

definitions.text: bend or lay so that one part covers the other
incorporate a food ingredient into a mixture by repeatedly turning it over without stirring or beating
examples: Fold the egg whites into the batter

definitions.text: cease to operate or cause to cease operating
examples: The owners decided to move and to close the factory
My business closes every night at 8 P.M.

definitions.text: confine in a fold, like sheep

examples: The bed folds in a jiffy
